div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
PETITION OF EDWARD KRAUSE FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.))) 3166
To the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the Circuit of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division:

The petition of Edward Krause of Petersburg, Ter- ritory of Alaska, respectfully shows to the Court that he is imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by the United States Marshall of the foregoing District in the State of Washington, County of King.
That said imprisonment and restraint are illegal because of the following facts, to-wit:

That the said Edward Krause was arrested upon a warrant is- sued by Robert W. McClelland, United States Commissioner for the Western District of Washington, upon the affidavit of one Clay Allen, deposing that the said Edward Krause had commit- ted a crime in the Territory of Alaska and outside of the State of Washington and against and in violation of Section 27 of the Alaska Criminal Code.

That a preliminary hearing was given the said Edward Krause before the said Commissioner in the County of King and State of Washington and that the said Commissioner has entered an order or judgment binding over the said

Edward Krause to the Grand Jury in the said Territory of Alaska at Juneau and that an order has been issued by this Court that the said Edward Krause be taken from the County of King and State of Washington by the United States Marshall for the Western District of Washington, to the Territory of Alaska at Juneau and there delivered to the United States Marshall of said District.

Your petitioner further shows that the act com- plained against your petitioner, if any he has committed, is not in violation of any law of the United States but that, according to the warrant, said act, if any has been committed by your petitioner, as alleged in the said affidavit, is in violation of the laws of the Territory of Alaska.

Your petitioner further shows that no extradition papers signed by the Governor of Alaska, as provided by law, has been issued and no rendition warrant for the arrest and extradition of the said Edward Krause has been issued by the Governor of the State of Washington or served upon said Edward Krause.

For the further reason that, as shown by the evi- dence introduced before the said Commissioner, there was no proof that any crime had been committed, in that the evidence showed that the petitioner had taken one William Christie from the Town of Treadwell to a place near the shore of Juneau in Alaska and that the said Christie was taken there- from by a third party; that the petitioner has seen in the papers published at Juneau that the said Christie had been abducted and that his whereabouts were not known; that the petitioner, fearing there might be trouble over Christie being brought from Treadwell to Juneau, left the vicinity of

Juneau, assumed the alias of Moe, and, fearing that he might become in difficulty because thereof, left the vicinity of Juneau and the Territory of Alaska; that no other evidence was introduced of the abduction or disappearance or absence of the said William Christie and no evidence was introduced of any search having been made for the said Christie.

That the said Edward Krause is not committed or de- tained by virtue of any process issued or any final judgment or decree of any competent tribunal of evil or criminal jurisdiction, or by virtue of any execution issued upon said judgment or decree.

Your petitioner therefore prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may issue, directed to the said Marshall of the United States for the Western District of Washington and to his deputies or any or either of them, commanding him that he have the body of the said Edward Krause, by him imprisoned and detained, together with the time and cause of said im- prisonment and detention, before the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer Judge of the District of the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, at the United States Court House at Seattle King County, State of Washington, at the hour of 2 P. M. on the 18th day of November, 1915, and to do and receive what shall there an then be considered or ordered concerning the said Edward Krause.
F. Gesttan O'Bryan Attorney for Petitioner.
3166 In U.S. District Court for Western District of Wash. for western division
Application of Edward Krause for writ of Habeas Corpus.
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington. OCT 18 1915 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By EmL. Deputy 2x
